name: Relari
headline: Testing and Simulation Stack for GenAI Systems
description:
Relari helps AI teams simulate, test, and validate complex AI applications throughout the development lifecycle.

We are the company behind continuous-eval, an open-source modular evaluation framework with metrics covering text generation, code generation, retrieval, classification, agents, and other LLM use cases. Our cloud platform generates custom synthetic data and simulates user behavior to stress test and harden GenAI applications.

founders.name: Yi Zhang, Founder
founders.description: Co-Founder & CEO of Relari. Previously building autonomous cars & trucks at Pony.ai and warehouse robots at Dexterity.ai. Harvard MBA.

founders.name: Pasquale Antonante, Founder
founders.description: Co-Founder & CTO of Relari. I have a PhD from MIT focusing on the reliability of complex AI systems such as autonomous cars. Previously at NVIDIA and Raytheon Technologies (previously United Technologies).

## Contract-based development
[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/669f7329c898141d69e16698/669f7329c898141d69e1671a_icon_Define.svg)DefineCreate natural language contracts collaboratively to capture your agent's expected behavior and reasoning process across all critical scenarios.](https://www.relari.ai/<#w-tabs-0-data-w-pane-0>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/669f7329c898141d69e16698/669f7329c898141d69e16728_icon_Measure.svg)VerifyRigorously test your agent's complete behavior across thousands of diverse scenarios through powerful simulation and synthetic test generation.](https://www.relari.ai/<#w-tabs-0-data-w-pane-1>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/669f7329c898141d69e16698/669f7329c898141d69e1671b_icon_Improve.svg)IterateGet immediate insights into how your agents execute complex tasks through comprehensive trace analysis, helping you rapidly catch and fix issues before deployment.](https://www.relari.ai/<#w-tabs-0-data-w-pane-2>)
## Trusted by AI pioneers
![Noam Rubin](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/669f7329c898141d69e16698/669f7329c898141d69e1672d_Noam%20Rubin.avif)
Noam Rubin
AI Engineer at
![vanta logo](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/669f7329c898141d69e16698/669f7329c898141d69e1672c_logo_vanta.avif)
Security Compliance AI
Before we had Relari, we relied on guesswork and instincts to select key parameters such as similarity threshold, chunk size, embedding models, and retrieval strategies. Using Relari’s synthetic golden datasets and tailored evaluation metrics, we were able to easily understand trade-offs among different parameters over large datasets, and make confident, informed decisions. This data-driven process significantly improved our iteration speed, allowing us to reach production-grade for multiple LLM products over a short period of time.
[Read the case study](https://www.relari.ai/</blog/vanta-case-study>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/669f7329c898141d69e166b3/669f7329c898141d69e166da_Jiang%20Chen.webp)
Jiang Chen
Head of Ecosystem and AI Platform 
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/669f7329c898141d69e166b3/669f7329c898141d69e16709_logo_milvus.webp)
Baseline LLM-as-a-judge is expensive and unstable. In a comprehensive RAG eval run, we spent $1,000+ bill on GPT4 tokens. It's also a challenge to collect domain-specific datasets. Relari's synthetic dataset generation and deterministic evaluation make it easier to develop high-quality LLM experience.

## Got a question?
What exactly are Agent Contracts?
They're natural-language specifications that define what an AI agent should do and its reasoning process—like 'check the order policy in the knowledge base and verify customer tier before approving any refund.' Relari turns these specifications into automated tests that verify if your agent follows the intended behavior, helping you catch and fix issues quickly.
What problems do Agent Contracts solve?
As AI agents tackle complex tasks with lengthy execution traces, it's hard to verify both their final outputs and their reasoning steps. Agent Contracts help teams quickly surface issues in the agent's decisions and steps during development, and automatically verify the complete behavior across scenarios after any code, prompt, or requirement changes.
Who should use Agent Contracts?
Teams building and deploying AI agents who need to ensure reliable behavior across scenarios. Natural language allows everyone who understands the user requirements and/or the technical implementations to shape the agents' expected behavior—from product and engineering to QA and domain experts.
How is this different from traditional LLM evaluation?
Traditional LLM metrics like correctness and faithfulness are fundamentally insufficient for understanding agent behavior—they completely miss how agents actually execute complex tasks by focusing only on the final outputs. With the Relari framework, you can analyze complex execution traces and rigorously check if each step matches the contract requirements, giving agent builders a comprehensive view of their agents' behavior.
How do Agent Simulation and Synthetic Test Cases work?
Agents need to handle diverse scenarios and edge cases, but manually creating and running all these tests is impractical. Relari lets you create custom simulators for your agents and generate synthetic test cases, multiplying your test coverage while saving time. For example, you can create different customer personas to test your support agent across a wide range of customer intent and interaction patterns.
Which AI platforms and frameworks are compatible?
Agent Contracts are platform-agnostic work with any agent framework—LangGraph, LlamaIndex, CrewAI, AutoGen, or any custom infrastructure. Simply log your agent's execution traces to Relari with a few lines of code and define your contracts in natural language. Relari handles the verification automatically.
I can’t have data leave my environment. Can I self-host Relari?
Yes, on our enterprise plan, we offer the option for customers to self-host Relari, ensuring your data remains within your environment.

Using Relari’s synthetic golden datasets and tailored evaluation metrics, we were able to easily understand trade-offs among different parameters over large datasets, and make confident, informed decisions. This data-driven process significantly improved our iteration speed, allowing us to reach production-grade for multiple LLM products over a short period of time.

## Got a question?
What exactly are Agent Contracts?
They're natural-language specifications that define what an AI agent should do and its reasoning process—like 'check the order policy in the knowledge base and verify customer tier before approving any refund.' Relari turns these specifications into automated tests that verify if your agent follows the intended behavior, helping you catch and fix issues quickly.
What problems do Agent Contracts solve?
As AI agents tackle complex tasks with lengthy execution traces, it's hard to verify both their final outputs and their reasoning steps. Agent Contracts help teams quickly surface issues in the agent's decisions and steps during development, and automatically verify the complete behavior across scenarios after any code, prompt, or requirement changes.
Who should use Agent Contracts?
Teams building and deploying AI agents who need to ensure reliable behavior across scenarios. Natural language allows everyone who understands the user requirements and/or the technical implementations to shape the agents' expected behavior—from product and engineering to QA and domain experts.
How is this different from traditional LLM evaluation?
Traditional LLM metrics like correctness and faithfulness are fundamentally insufficient for understanding agent behavior—they completely miss how agents actually execute complex tasks by focusing only on the final outputs. With the Relari framework, you can analyze complex execution traces and rigorously check if each step matches the contract requirements, giving agent builders a comprehensive view of their agents' behavior.
How do Agent Simulation and Synthetic Test Cases work?
Agents need to handle diverse scenarios and edge cases, but manually creating and running all these tests is impractical. Relari lets you create custom simulators for your agents and generate synthetic test cases, multiplying your test coverage while saving time. For example, you can create different customer personas to test your support agent across a wide range of customer intent and interaction patterns.
Which AI platforms and frameworks are compatible?
Agent Contracts are platform-agnostic work with any agent framework—LangGraph, LlamaIndex, CrewAI, AutoGen, or any custom infrastructure. Simply log your agent's execution traces to Relari with a few lines of code and define your contracts in natural language. Relari handles the verification automatically.
I can’t have data leave my environment. Can I self-host Relari?
Yes, on our enterprise plan, we offer the option for customers to self-host Relari, ensuring your data remains within your environment.

generated_description:
### Relari: Transforming AI Development at Speed

**Overview:**
Founded in 2023 and a proud member of Y Combinator's Batch W24, Relari is a fresh player focusing on the testing and simulation stack for Generative AI (GenAI) systems. With a tight-knit team of just two, they're shaking things up in the AI landscape by offering powerful tools that enable AI development teams to simulate, test, and validate complex applications. 

**Mission:**
Relari is on a clear mission: to simplify the testing and validation process for GenAI systems. They help AI teams assess their applications rigorously throughout the development lifecycle, improving reliability and effectiveness at each stage.

**Core Offering:**
At the heart of Relari's platform is **continuous-eval**, an open-source modular evaluation framework that provides detailed metrics for various Large Language Model (LLM) applications, including text and code generation, retrieval, classification, and agent behavior. 

The cloud-based platform stands out by generating custom synthetic data and simulating user behavior to stress test GenAI applications. This approach means developers can identify weaknesses and fortify their solutions even before deployment.

**Agent Contracts:**
One of the standout features is the concept of **Agent Contracts**. This intuitive, natural-language way of describing an AI agent's expected behaviors serves two purposes:
1. It helps define the agent's purpose clearly.
2. It allows developers to create automated tests that verify compliance with the expected behavior, streamlining the debugging process.

### Why Relari Matters
Many AI teams grapple with the complexity of developing responsive agents capable of navigating intricate tasks. Traditional metrics focus heavily on the final output, often missing crucial aspects of agent behavior, like the reasoning and process behind decisions. Relari addresses this gap, enabling a robust toolkit for creating agents that not only perform well but do so in a predictable and verifiable manner.

### Pricing Structure:
Relari offers a tiered pricing model:

- **Community**: Free for individual developers and researchers looking for open-source metrics.
- **Starter**: Ideal for developers wanting access to a broader suite of tools for free.
- **Team**: $1,000/month for teams looking to deploy reliable applications at scale.
- **Enterprise**: Custom pricing to accommodate larger teams with specialized needs.

### Advantages of Using Relari:
- **Robust Testing**: With custom synthetic test case generation and agent simulation, teams can expand their test coverage efficiently.
- **Seamless Integration**: Compatible with various AI frameworks, teams can integrate Agent Contracts into their existing workflows effortlessly.
- **Data Security**: For clients with stringent privacy needs, Relari offers self-hosting options on its enterprise plan.

### Conclusion
In a world where AI is becoming integral to countless systems, the ability to trust those systems is paramount. Relari empowers developers with the tools necessary to not just build, but build with confidence. Their focus on reducing complexity in the validation of AI agents could very well set a new standard in the industry. If you're looking to supercharge the reliability of your AI applications, Relari’s platform might just be the game-changer you need. 

**Ready to dive deeper?** Explore more on their [website](https://www.relari.ai/) and see how they can help elevate your AI projects.
